website_summaries.verdict: Delivers a customizable toasting experience that allows you to determine your shade level.
pros: High-lift lever makes toast easy to reach
Slots accommodate various types of bread, including bagels
cons: Toasting takes a little while, and finding a preferred setting may require trial and error

customer_reviews.title: This is a fake!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a real Krups brand toaster. It's a real bummer that you have to worry about buying fake products on this site...seems like it is becoming more and more of a problem. This arrived with the letters rubbed off and is a completely flimsy toaster. I actually went to one of the big box stores to look at the REAL Krups toaster (same model) to verify that this one is in fact fake. Also, there is no stop/cancel button so your food will either burn or not toast completely. And if you touch anywhere around the top of the toaster afterwards, you will burn the crap out of your hands. Super dangerous, obviously being returned.
customer_reviews.author: FLGal

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Sent this back, it only toasted on the top 3/4's of the bread. The bottom wasn't toasted.
customer_reviews.author: Camarillo

customer_reviews.title: Beauty and function at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really enjoying my new toaster.. perfect toast every time and love the bagel and defrost features. I'll agree that the levers are a little lightweight and take some getting used to as I used to have to really press down on my old toaster so I'm still getting used to using a gentle touch on this one. Overall, love the look on my counter... it's clean and sleek and could not be happier! Oh and it's nice actually being able to have 4 slots! Mom can actually have toast WITH the family instead of making toast for everyone and having to finally sit down when everyone is done lol all in all, very happy with this little gem.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: Big Disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: I did my research when purchasing this toaster. Both Amazon and Consumer Reports rated it very high, so that is why I purchased it. It toasts the bread unevenly AND one of the slots has higher heat so if the toaster is on a higher setting, one piece is burnt and the other is toasted properly. This toaster looks great and expensive, but I want a toaster that can toast evenly and the temperature the same in both slots. Is that too much to ask?
customer_reviews.author: SKT

customer_reviews.title: Defective???
customer_reviews.text: For the price I was expecting a good toaster. I was purchasing another toaster because after years of use my T-Fal toaster was starting to toast unevenly. I tried to toast some bread, starting with the 2nd setting, not toasted, turned it up and up and up to highest setting and I still had to toast it twice. Toasting was very uneven, made my T-Fal look great. I returned it. I assume I just got a bad toaster since others have not had the same issue but once and done is enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Bad Experience
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about replacing my old toaster which had issues. When this arrived I was happy to see how handsome if was. However looks are not as important as good toast. Regardless of what type or shape of bread I use the back end is darker than the front. I have to stop it in the middle and turn the bread around to get an even piece of toast. Not what I expected and a nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't toast evenly
customer_reviews.text: This toaster would be 5 stars, easily, if it toasted evenly on both sides. Alas, it doesn't, so it's close to worthless. On the bagel setting, it's supposed to really only toast one-sided. However, when the bagel setting is off, it should toast evenly one both sides of the bread. You know, like a toaster. Unfortunately, it toasts nicely on one side and almost not at all on the other. Otherwise, it's a pretty toaster. Shiny stainless steel. Many settings. Easy to operate. Sadly, it doesn't do the one thing it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY poor performance!  Highly over rated and over priced
customer_reviews.text: Looks good but once again its putting lipstick on a pig. Totally inefficient!! Doesn't toast properly or evenly and takes too long to do it. Dials have to be set at highest position to get close to a proper piece of "one sided toast". Typical made in China poorly quality controlled over priced product. Unfortunately due to Amazon policy I am stuck with it! I would throw it in the garbage if It didn't cost so much.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Parks Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Toaster is nice looking with all kinds of good features but it ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this toaster based on reviews that said it evenly toasted the bread. Toaster is nice looking with all kinds of good features but it left one side of the bread barely toasted. Performed worse than the more modestly priced toaster I was replacing. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cautiously optimistic...sort of.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this toaster for a few weeks. I sure wish they made things to last, but it seems that pretty much *everything* is made with a preordained expiration date now. (makes me hate a shareholder-driven economy sometimes...) This toaster is incredibly lightweight and flimsy-feeling. I'll be surprised if it lasts the year. Will come back and eat crow this time next year if it's still working. In the meantime, it does defrost and toast evenly. Things that are thick and frozen take two go-'rounds, but it does still get the job done without ruining whatever is being toasted. Fingers crossed (although that makes it hard to type... ;-) )
customer_reviews.author: Seachelle

customer_reviews.title: Does what you want a toaster to do
customer_reviews.text: This toaster has been in service for 13 months, adequate time for a review. First, after spending hours reading reviews of toaster, I became mortified. For crying out out how hard can it be to choose a toaster? And why do we think a 40.00 product should be perfect in this imperfect world? That being said, I highly recommend this product. Was not interested in a digital display, a few setting is sufficient in my world. Is it perfect ?.... No but it is close enough to being that with simplicity that it's worth the value. Cleans up readily, accepts bagels & thick bread slices. Save yourself from the frustrating reviews search.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry C.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Toaster
customer_reviews.text: Best toaster ever. Toasts quickly and evenly, and looks really nice on the counter. I like the pop up button as well. Had a kitchen aid for years, that cost more, took forever to toast, and the toast was always half done. Nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Susan H Foster

customer_reviews.title: Cheap looking and not toasting well after 1 Month
customer_reviews.text: We got this toaster a month ago. First of all, it looks and feels cheap compared to our last stainless toaster which had more heft and didn't seem as flimsy or garish. But what's worse... When we first got it, it toasted at the "3" setting. Now all of a sudden, we have to turn it to 5 out of 6 to toast the same bread the same amount as previously toasted on 3. And this is just for a nice, golden brown toast, not really dark. I gave it 2 stars because it still works, but I'm wondering for how long.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Toasts evenly! No space for crumb collection! No fingerprints!
customer_reviews.text: This KRUPS toaster exceeds my expectations! I did a lot of research on long slot toasters and even purchased two highly rated, upscale long slot toasters. I returned both as neither did the main function of a toaster : TOAST bread evenly ! PROS • Toasts bread evenly • Toasts bread consistently • Lever is sturdy • Pops up high for easy toast removal • Smooth steel top with zero crevices for crumb collection • Easy to wipe clean • No fingerprints! I thought the shiny steel would get smudged. Nope! • Sleek, simple design • Compact size is not a counter hog CON: • Only better if it was a long slot version was available.
customer_reviews.author: Winston22

customer_reviews.title: How to toast a perfect single slice of bread.
customer_reviews.text: Great toaster. Very even browning of bread. This is a two slice of bread toaster. Some reviews said bread only toasted one side as if a bagel and so returned the toaster. Wrong. They must have only put in one slice and left the other slot empty. So all the heat from the empty slot was directed at the center element that then got overheated resulting in excess Browning of the bread facing the center element. To overcome this heating imbalance put some unwanted slice, like the loaf end, in the 'empty' slot, or a heat proof tile. Perfect single slice every time!
customer_reviews.author: David Yell

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking toaster in good working order
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought the "bestseller" toaster here on Amazon. Sent it back after one toasting because of the awful toxic chemical smell it emitted. I decided to use the "get what you pay for" strategy, and this toaster is much better. It feels better made, looks modern and clean, and toasts bagels perfectly. Completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: MLB

customer_reviews.title: just as I like it. 4 slots (adjustable by twos) make it ...
customer_reviews.text: This toaster makes toast that is crispy outside and soft inside, just as I like it. 4 slots (adjustable by twos) make it easy to produce breakfast or bacon lettuce and tomato sandwiches for two people without having to wait so long. Good looking design. Saw it at a vacation rental and thought about how much better I like toasters than toaster ovens and decided to buy myself one. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Rossatini

customer_reviews.title: Good toaster! It does what it's designed to do ...
customer_reviews.text: Good toaster! It does what it's designed to do & does it well. I've toasted bread, bagels & toaster waffles & Pop-tarts, no problems. You'll have to adjust the degree of toasting to your own preference of course, but once you figure out which setting is right for what you're toasting & your personal preference, this toaster works very well. I really like the extra wide slots & a 4 slot toaster is really great when you have company for breakfast. B.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster!
customer_reviews.text: Good toaster. Easy to use. Lightweight. Works perfectly. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb G

customer_reviews.title: Still looking for a good toaster
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a toaster that toasts one side perfect and the other side hardly at all, then this is your toaster. Looks great on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy This!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the worst toaster I have ever experienced. Terrible. I bought this because it was a Krupp. I expected high quality. It is useless as a toaster. Quality is extremely poor. Actually it does not function at all as a toaster. I find it hard to believe that a company would market this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster to replace a toaster that always seemed to toast one side but not the other. Yes, the elements were working on both sides. I figured I needed a new toaster and may as well go with one that handles 4 slices. Oh yes, it's shiny and looks kind of cool. It is the slowest toaster I have ever experienced. By the time this makes toast, I've forgotten I was even making toast. I've put it on the highest setting, lowest, everything in between. It is too slow to have any usefulness at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lissie

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy...
customer_reviews.text: This product did not evenly toast anything. I would put a piece of toast in half would be black the other half would be completely untouched. The materials used are very cheap, and it doesn’t feel well built. The browning feature is off, and using the 6 setting sometimes burns it, sometimes toasts it perfectly. It’s not a good toaster.
customer_reviews.author: David michail

customer_reviews.title: Krups KH732D - Do not recommend (unless you prefer burnt toast)
customer_reviews.text: I have endured this toaster for 14 months and can now justify replacing it. We like our toast done medium brown--not too light, not too dark. I have always had to put toast down twice with this Krups model and set a timer for 30 seconds so it doesn't burn. Additionally, after the first slices of toast are made, subsequent slices burn, even though the setting remains the same. I do not recommend. I gave it one star for its sleek design. It's a great counter ornament.
customer_reviews.author: K. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre At Best...
customer_reviews.text: Should've listened to my gut feeling when I contemplated ordering this unit. Something in my gut told me not to order--but I did anyway. Noted the following: 1) Toasting of bread is NOT consistent. 2) Sometimes lower half of slice isn't toasted. 3) Sometimes one side of bread is nicely toasted--other side is either too light or burned. 4) Hubby's frozen waffles are a disaster. Since we only use this toaster 2-3 times per week, I'll keep it until I can find one locally....one that I can see, touch and thoroughly examine.
customer_reviews.author: NMGal

customer_reviews.title: Toaster Tech Fail
customer_reviews.text: What is it with toasters? From the cheap to the expensive they are disappointing (kind of like blenders). With the wonderful world of microchips and other tech miracles you would think someone could design a decent toaster. This toaster: Loesn't toast evenly top to bottom or front to back. First batch toasts ok, next one much darker (or burnt) than first one. To be fair every toaster I have ever owned has had the same problems. My conclusion: buy the cheapest one you can 'cause cost doesn't seem to mean much.
customer_reviews.author: naturegirl

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great toaster just be patient!!
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around a lot before buying this toaster. Overall it does a great job and evenly toasts on both sides of the bread. I do find it a bit slow so be patient! The one thing I never thought of until I started using it was that my previous toaster had the slots designed on an angle (the front of the toaster was angled) which I now realize was great for our kitchen set up. We have the toaster underneath a cabinet and although there is ample room I do have to say that I liked the angled toaster better than the flat top on this one - obviously that has no affect on performance but just personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Don Mac

customer_reviews.title: Krups Review
customer_reviews.text: I like the toaster. It is easy to use and looks nice with the stainless finish. My biggest disappointment is that, even though I searched and found that it was made in the USA - when the box came it said "Made in China." That was almost cause to return the product. I did not mind paying more for this toaster because I thought it was made in the USA. To pay this much for something made in China - when there are other Made in China products cheaper - that kind of irritates me.
customer_reviews.author: BLWeb

customer_reviews.title: The most annoying toaster I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: The first issue was that the toast is always somewhat browner on one side. I thought that was a bit annoying for an expensive toaster, but I that was just the beginning. This toaster has the common Bagel feature, so that if you push a button, it lights up the Bagel light, and toast only one side. The problem is that it started randomly turning on this feature by itself about half the time. Nothing I tried (including unplugging and replugging) would turn off the bagel feature on some days. I hate the hassle of returning stuff on warrantee, or it would be long gone.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip J. Restle

customer_reviews.title: Consistent performance
customer_reviews.text: Happy with toast consistency on both sides of bread (see photos). The slot widths are a bit short - about 5.25”, would have preferred something more like 7” to accommodate artisan breads. (Don’t want the very long toaster version.) Tried another toaster, it gave very inconsistent results and will be returned; when you buy a toaster, expect to return one or a few until you get one that works well.
customer_reviews.author: TRZ

customer_reviews.title: A chrome toaster - Shows every little fingerprint and smudge
customer_reviews.text: Way overpriced for what it is. The description made it sound like it is stainless steel but it's a coated chrome finish (like a mirror) so it shows every little finger print and smudge. It's also so chintzy and weighs almost nothing so when you press the toaster handle down you can actually tip it over if you're not careful, or it slides because there's nothing holding it in place. If you want a chrome lightweight toaster, it is the toaster for you. But I prefer a toaster that doesn't show finger prints and has some weight to it.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: The name Krups once meant quality but they have decided to get rich quick by paying cheap labor and buying cheap components in China. First, the toast did not brown equally, now it toasts only on one side. Two years old and ready for the landfill. Thanks China, thanks Krups, I'll now look for an antique American made toaster. I do have a 60 year old waffle grill that works great. Made in USA. Never again Krups, and I can live without anything made in China, I'm getting a lot of practice and saving my money too.
customer_reviews.author: robert d. wooton

customer_reviews.title: Would Not Get Hot Enough
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the toaster we received would not get hot enough. When trying to toast bread, the heating elements would get orange only toward the far edges, while the main section of the elements remained black. The bread would never toast/brown but would warm up slowly and would become rock hard. I guess the toaster we received was a "lemon" and we were just unlucky. The majority cannot work this way or they would not have received so many positive reviews. However, instead of replacing it with another of the same model, we chose to send it back for a refund and purchased a different brand instead.
customer_reviews.author: joanieD

customer_reviews.title: Is this toaster what it claims to be?
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure this is a real toaster as we commonly think of them. It does not seem to work like all the traditional toasters I have had in the past. There is something different about this toaster but I don't know what that is. It works differently and not as expected. I would not recommend this toaster for bagels, you may have to toast them more than once (on cycle). The toaster is well made and it works but it does not work in the traditional manner. Think about it before you buy and think again and again before you commit.
customer_reviews.author: John Nemaric - PhD

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: Have only owned for a few weeks. Bought after extensive research that showed that all toasters are pieces of junk so I decided not to spend a lot. It looks nice sitting on the counter but it is unbelievably light and flimsy. At the highest setting it just barely browns the bread. Seems like best strategy is to not spend much, buy something pretty with features you like - pay attention to bagel feature if you want only 1 side toasted. And be prepared to replace it in a year depending on use.
customer_reviews.author: Carolin Malott

customer_reviews.title: Love love LOVE this toaster
customer_reviews.text: First off, try to find a toaster that makes bagels properly; this is one of the few left on the market. Then, find one that makes perfectly browned toast out of all types of bread. Finally, find one that still looks good and performs well after a year's worth of daily use. The Krups ticks all boxes. (I bought mine 18 months ago.)
customer_reviews.author: Costero

customer_reviews.title: Nice Toaster
customer_reviews.text: Our Daughter bought this for us for Christmas, finally we have a toaster that actually works. The bread is toasted on both sides, something our old toaster didn't. I like the feature of lifting the handle up to bring English Muffins up to the top of the toaster for easy removal instead of sticking a fork in there. The Cancel button is a nice feature to stop the toasting cycle.
customer_reviews.author: John L Treadwell

customer_reviews.title: Not made in USA
customer_reviews.text: I need a new toaster and did not want to buy anything from China. I went searching and found several sites claiming this former German company claiming this is made in America. I took the plunge. The package arrived, opened the box, big as life on the top, "Made in China." Closed that right back up and sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: allthingsgood

customer_reviews.title: Poor toasting and dangerously hot on top
customer_reviews.text: After replacing a toaster that lasted 12 years, I'm seriously disappointed. This seems very flimsy compared to my old Breville, I'm surprised that it gets past the Consumer Product Safety Commission. As other reviewers have noted, it gets blisteringly hot on top, although it stays cool on the sides. It's easy enough to brush the top by mistake, and a child could easily get burned. Which I could overlook if it were a great toaster, but the range from a setting of 4 (out of 6) to 5 is the difference between crisp but barely brown and burned. Maybe with time I will find the optimal temperature--as one reviewer pointed out, it may depend on the type of bread.
customer_reviews.author: Rappers Mom

customer_reviews.title: Think twice about buying this
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it looks. However, although we have had it for a littlest more than 2 months, it no longer toasts as well. We have to put it on a higher and higher setting to even get a slight browning on our toast. We intend to contact Krups about this as there is no return option for this item on Amazon. We like it initially, but are having second thoughts.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Lentz

customer_reviews.title: Has a quality look and feel
customer_reviews.text: What's the old joke? What's the difference between a 20 dollar toaster and a 40 dollar toaster? 20 bucks. Well, this toaster arrived and it is rather nice...works well and has a quality look and feel to it. I cannot speak to its longevity but the last cheap toaster bottomed out after 9 months. I like this unit.
customer_reviews.author: OL

customer_reviews.title: cheap, cheap, cheap
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. The outside of the toaster gets very hot so that you have to use oven mitts to work it. The pop-up lever does not work very well and you have to force it to pop up. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Good looking toaster, good looking toast
customer_reviews.text: This is a good looking toaster, much better looking than the white (or should I say yellowish-white) Proctor-Silex Cool-Touch. It does a good job, with the following pros & cons: Pros: - More even toasting over the entire surface of the bread than our old model (no stripes or light spots). - Both sides are toasted the same (the old model always toasted one side more than the other) Cons: - It takes longer to reach the same level of toasting (seems like it uses a lower toasting temperature)
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Wenger

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes...
customer_reviews.text: OK it works fairly well, but like others have said, I have to put the darkness setting on 5 or 6 for proper toasting even on lighter breads. It does toast fairly evenly, but it takes a long time. Consumer reports rated it well, so now I have a bone to pick with them. Seriously, can't any manufacturer make a decent toaster !!!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and does the job
customer_reviews.text: Good: Toasts thoroughly and consistently. Adjusts to give good results with every type of bread I've tried in it. Levers lift the bread nice and high for removal without touching the case, which is important - see below. Dual-heat bagel mode warms the outside while toasting the inside; works well and is surprisingly useful. Easy to clean. Attractive retro-modern case. Bad: Case gets quite hot to the touch; unsurprising given the stainless steel but a little insulation would be a good idea. Bottom line: One of the better toasters I've used. A bit on the pricey side, but worth it. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Rich H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toast.
customer_reviews.text: Ok. I got this because my (very nice) toaster oven, which I've had for years, doesn't really excel at evenly toasting bread. When this unit arrived, I was a little awed by the ultra-shiny finish, but once I got some sunglasses on, all was well. I inserted two pieces of Publix Bakery bread, set the dial to mid-range, and a few minutes later, WOW! Perfectly golden-brown toast. Both sides were toasted evenly. What more could I ask for. I haven't tried the defrost or reheat settings, and I didn't have any bagels on hand, but if it does as well on those, this is an absolute winner.
customer_reviews.author: Tony B.

customer_reviews.title: It Makes Toast, Ya Dink!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my husband, because, uh, he likes toast. Great story, I know. He picked it out and I bought it for him because we are old. AND IT WILL HAPPEN TO YOU TOOO! WOOOOOOOO, BE AFRAAAIDDD. I'M THE GHOST OF RELATIONSHIPS FUTURE! WOOOOOOO!! Anyway, it looks nice, makes consistent toast, and I do not give a flying frappe about this because toast is *literally* the worst food. Who cares. Toast.
customer_reviews.author: Basil Abraxas

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best toaster we've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Looks great on the counter! We wanted a four slice toaster, since we both eat two slices of toast every morning. Separate adjustments for each side, so we can have toastier toast, or less crisp toast. It seems like a very well made product, and we love it, after a couple of months of use.
customer_reviews.author: pat thompson

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered even at top setting
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy bagels and toast cooked promptly and accurately. This toaster does neither. With its four relatively wide slots and impressive-appearing settings designed to deliver a job through six levels of toasting, this toaster falls far short of satisfactory. I have been reduced to putting the setting at its highest point and still I have to repeat it a second time half way through to achieve only the slightest browning (more like weak tan). To make matters worse, its slow, ploddingly slow. I could perhaps tolerate this shortcoming if the end product was satisfactorily completed, but its not. Buying this the first time, shame on me......you know the rest! I would recommend that you look elsewhere for a 4-slot toaster.
customer_reviews.author: john sinks

customer_reviews.title: Gets really hot
customer_reviews.text: The outside of the toaster gets very hot so you have to be careful if your toast doesn’t pop up completely. It doesn’t toast evenly and often my English muffins slip off the toaster ‘shelf’ and I have to unplug and dig the muffin out of the toaster. Every fingerprint shows up on the stainless steel. I much preferred my old toaster (of 18+ years) that had a plastic housing.
customer_reviews.author: Kona coast

customer_reviews.title: Does not brown evenly
customer_reviews.text: The one thing I like is the looks so if that's your overriding concern then this may be for you. The chrome looks cool, but shows fingerprints. I replaced my last toaster because it would only brown on one side without burning the other. This Krup browns on both sides (although not evenly), but the top will be very brown while bottom wasn't touched. The mechanism feels kind of cheap too, not like our Cuisinart. Disappointing for a $50 toaster. Due to the browning issue this was returned. The primary purpose of a toaster is to brown, if it doesn't do that well then it won't have a place in our house.
customer_reviews.author: billcb

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly Good Toaster
customer_reviews.text: In general my experience with toasters has not been great. Every new model seems more cheaply built; plastic has replaced steel; they all seem to heat unevenly; they go kaput. All of these criticisms can be applied in greater or lesser --mostly lesser!-- degree to this toaster (except, thankfully, the last one: it has not broken down.) It toasts fast and it's easy to clean. It is certainly better than several other brands I have bought, but I'm not opening the champagne yet. I've only had it for a couple of months. If it does this well in two years, it's worth a fifth star!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I Bought
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and really does a great job on everything I want to toast. Great video on YouTube as well. One draw back is it scratches WAY too easy. Turned it upside down on my counter , to wrap the plug and wire. Turned it back over and the top had scratches in it. Can't imagine this getting any better cleaning over the years but will put it on a soft towel from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Shoeprints

customer_reviews.title: UGLY, DEFECTIVE TOASTER SHOULD BE DELETED FROM AMAZON
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this toaster to replace same 4 year old Krups toaster. The new iteration is terrible, biggest problem is it is defective, left side doesn’t toast at all. Shiny outside metal is fake, horrible type of material used for toy toasters. Both toasters made in China - while my old toaster also stopped toasting on the left side, at least it looked like brushed stainless steel. The new one is really tacky - goodbye Krups!
customer_reviews.author: YELLOW ROSE

customer_reviews.title: beautiful toaster
customer_reviews.text: A new toaster was needed so I chose this one. I like this brand. I have a Krups grinder that i use for coffee beans etc....and it works great (I've had it serveral years now). This is a very pretty toaster! It is chrome in the front & back & the sides are stainless steel. It's easy to clean and it toasts evenly (I even toasted some brioche rolls & put it on the lowest setting and they came out lightly toasted-this bread has a tendency to burn if you don't watch it but the bread came out great! no burning! All in all, a great & beautiful toaster!
customer_reviews.author: dog lover

customer_reviews.title: A good, solid toaster
customer_reviews.text: I was torn -- CR rates this highly; amazon users don't seem to. But our Cuisinart died, and the price for this Krups was also very reasonable, so it seemed worth the risk. I honestly don't know what all the negative reviews are about. Maybe they received a different product (although it is fulfilled by amazon). The box and toaster were obviously genuine Krups products. The toaster works great the first time, at least. We'll see over time -- I'll update this if it changes. But with the price, amazon's return policy, and CR's rating, this is a good buy. My experience seems to bear this out.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Kowalewski

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, cheap, and not giving you hot waffle.
customer_reviews.text: It looks really nice on photo or from a distance. Here is where quality stops. It is made of cheap plastic, very light so when you use it moves around. When toast pops up sounds like empty coke can. It doesn't heat well, any thick waffle doesn't get hot in the middle, even on maximum setting. Very disappointed with Krups. You would think there is some German pride in it, but no. It is just another piece of disposable junk. It appears there is very hard to find well built toaster. Will try with $150 English made one. Hope it will prove better.
customer_reviews.author: Zorandinho

customer_reviews.title: Bad unit
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, this was purchased through Amazon Warehouse as "will be shipped in original package, package will be damaged." The toaster received was new, no indication that the packaging had been opened, and elements gave off the typical smokey wisps and odor of a new toaster. But the elements did not heat evenly, bread toasted on one side only in all the 4 slots. Returned to Amazon. This was probably just a bad unit, but I can't provide a better review based on this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Walters

customer_reviews.title: Love this toaster!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster a couple of years ago and hadn't realized that I never reviewed it. So now I can say it from down the road. I love it! It works perfectly. You can easily set the exact amount of doneness you want. It'll do a variety of thicknesses of bread. It heats quickly and works efficiently. I don't know what more I can say about a toaster, but I have had some in the past that were huge disappointments, so this one does not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Book lover in Leeds

customer_reviews.title: Good toaster. Odd smell though
customer_reviews.text: Consumer Reports top-rates this toaster and thus far I have no major complaints. The manual says to run it a few times on the high/dark setting to "burn off any dust." I did so, and subsequently have made toast a number of times, and it continues to have a sort of factory-dusty smell. I hope this goes away soon.
customer_reviews.author: F. Krasowska

customer_reviews.title: Too many things were wrong with this for me
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box the toaster took 5+ minutes to lightly toast my bread. Although i really didnt like that I felt I could live with it. Then we tried the Bagel setting....I gave up...way too long. Then the nail in the coffin was after about 4-5 days the bread would be ejected out of the toaster after only 2 minutes and it had not begun to toast. So I would restart it and then it would not shut off by itself. Way burnt toast, plus not very safe. So, i returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Great quality sunflower seeds
customer_reviews.text: Great quality sunflower seeds. It comes in a durable zip-lock bag. Shipping was fast. I will order it again. This beautiful toaster makes a statement on my otherwise boring kitchen! Works great evenly toasting the bread. We use several times a day. So far so good (used it for about a month). I hope that it will continue to perform as well. Knobs have pleasant fell when turning, blue LED lights (when in use) give modern feel, pushing levers have solid feel.
customer_reviews.author: bon_leon

customer_reviews.title: KRUPS KH732D50 2-Slice Toaster Short-Term Review
customer_reviews.text: I'm always reluctant to write reviews on products I've just purchased. I like giving products time to show their quirks. So, in the 19 days I've owned the products it has lived up to all the positive specs, and shown no negative issues. I'm pleased with it. Working between the lowest and middle range of it's heating capability it offers uniform and pleasant looking toasting across the surface of the bread or whatever I happen to be toasting. My biggest test will be durability. I hope to give a positive review 5 years down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Freq

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality heating elements
customer_reviews.text: Every other toaster I've owned in my life you could see the heating elements glow and the toast got done quickly. No glow here. I suspect they skimped on the quality of the heating elements. The result is toast takes longer and the bread is more dried out and not as appealing (unless you like warm croutons). Krups had a reputation for high quality products. This one is pretty poor. I'm thinking about replacing it already even though I have had it for only 2 weeks. I LIKE MY TOAST!
customer_reviews.author: Woody Glade

customer_reviews.title: Wish it worked as well as it looks
customer_reviews.text: Worked great the first week... Then slowly the toaster took longer and longer to toast. By week 3, it took 5 minutes to cook a toaster waffle. I'm returning and going back to Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Mominator4

customer_reviews.title: Great Toaster!
customer_reviews.text: Great toaster! We got a better price here than Wal-Mart. It toasts well. Sure maybe not 100% even....but I have NEVER seen a toaster do that. It's still like 80-90%....good enough at the price level. The darkness selection is nice in the fact that you can see where you're setting it.....and it clicks into place on the whole number and half. The lightest setting is actually very light. Whereas many toasters, the lightest setting is about right and it's only burned beyond that.....not this one. Calibrated pretty nice. Love the way it lights up to let you know what you've got going on.
customer_reviews.author: CoWag

customer_reviews.title: 4 Eggos At Once!
customer_reviews.text: Have you ever thought, "Do I really need to toast four Eggos at once?" You absolutely do. This toaster is fast and durable. It does get fingerprinty and it's also hot in the one place that you want to touch. When you first make toast in it, it smells like burning plastic. I've gotten used to not touching the hot places and wiping the fingerprints and I do love the toaster.
customer_reviews.author: London

customer_reviews.title: Started out great....BUT
customer_reviews.text: Crapped out today after just four (4) months of use. I used it once a day, four days a week, to toast half a bagel for my breakfast. Oh, well. I just bought a Hamilton Beach Cool Wall 2-Slice Toaster (available on Amazon) to replace it. The HB was half the price of the Krups. I'm hoping for better luck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Lomenzo

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk - Obviously No Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this a negative rating I would. It didn't last 6 months before it completely stopped working. The divider with the heating wires between the 2 slots started to fall apart shortly after we received it causing one of the wires to jut out into one of the slots resulting in a burnt spot on the toast. Finally the divider cracked in half and became detached from the toaster itself so it now just hangs there held up by the heater wires. The toaster did not work at all after that. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Lewis

customer_reviews.title: doesn't brown evenly
customer_reviews.text: For some reason this is probably true for all toasters. For 2 slices of toast there are 4 sides. This toaster browns them all differently. Some sides are not even evenly toasted on that side. I must admit that it is consistent in it's uneven browning each time that 2 slices are toasted. I wouldn't think it would be too hard to design a toaster that works as expected but I am not a toaster engineer. Otherwise, the toaster seems to be built well, easy to use, and is attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Koby

customer_reviews.title: Thought This Toaster Would Be Great! It's NOT!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed because I had an older toaster that didn't toast bread evenly on both sides. I read the reviews of the Krups model and purchased it because one of the claims stated that bread toasted evenly on both sides. It Doesn't!! It's no better than the old toaster I had. I'm totally not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jose A. Sardina

customer_reviews.title: Toasts even
customer_reviews.text: Nice toaster for the money nothing fancy but it works well and toast very even. UPDATE: Still like toaster but one safety issue in my opinion. The feet of the toaster does not grab a hard smooth counter top. When you use the cancel button the pressure required to depress it causes the unit to slide. So you have to hold it in place with one hand and depress the cancel button with the other. Easy right? NO! This toaster shell gets hot so you cant hold it in place from top so its sides or back and get hot enough to sting you when you touch it.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Preziosi

customer_reviews.title: Toaster does not perform!
customer_reviews.text: After just a week or two the heating element requires you put the item your cooking in two or three time. Not happy with performance, looks good but that all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I should have believed the other reviews brand new toaster and it doesn't toast properly half of the wires that heat and cook the toast don't even work didn't waste my time returning it very disappointed horrible product
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight - not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this two position toaster based on reviews and also on weight in product information section as indicator of construction quality. Advertised shipping weight is 5.4 lbs, actual is 2.37 lbs. Advertised item weight is 3.27 lbs, actual retail package is 1.9 lbs, out of package toaster weight is 1.35 lbs. By contrast, my old Breville 2-position toaster is almost double the weight at 2.56 lbs. I will return and purchase another Breville.
customer_reviews.author: KMBen

customer_reviews.title: Premature failure
customer_reviews.text: Purchase 12/2017 KH732050 initally worked well by one year toasting on left side of both slots weak. by August of 2019 we began to turn up toasting level up past 4 or 5 and now one side is nearly blackened and the other side of both pieces of bread were just barely brown. WE by chance purchased a Asurion warranty from Amazon and now having to use it. FYI the original price for this item was $33.00 now $49.50 I guess the Trump tarriff got in there some way.
customer_reviews.author: Dee6978

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster of my life
customer_reviews.text: I bough this toaster almost three years ago, It is the best toaster I’ve ever had in over 30 years of marriage. It will toast a bagel so that when you take it out the butter melts because the bagel is hot. I’ve had toasters that barely toasts bread and when it does it takes forever. Guaranteed your butter and cream cheese will melt into Your bagel once toasted in this toaster. Just in case somebody’s in the market for a toaster. 🥯 😋
customer_reviews.author: Leasajo

customer_reviews.title: In spite of excellent reviews even in Consumer Reports
customer_reviews.text: In spite of excellent reviews even in Consumer Reports, it doesn't toast artisan bread very well or other quality bakery breads. I've tried all the settings & altho high does toast, the entire piece of bread is dried out. Since I store it over my microwave it is almost impossible to graba hold of it when you want it moved to the counter. I previously owned a kitchen store & sold Krups products but this is not the quality of the past!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Metal toaster = too hot to touch it!
customer_reviews.text: Looks pretty and shiny... but the entire toaster gets hot! When I opened it, I ran it twice, with nothing inside. The sides and front of the toaster were very hot. (Except for the plastic lever and knob.) I'm not happy about losing $10-15 for the shipping charge to return it... but this is not going to be safe for my kids to use!
customer_reviews.author: TXmom

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and works well
customer_reviews.text: I've used the toaster for a few months now. The slots are wide enough for a bagel. They are long enough for most, but not all, pieces of rye bread (which is normally longer than white or wheat). Mechanically, the toaster works very nicely. The darkness control works well and so does the Cancel button. Some other reviewers have complained that the bread does not brown evenly. I agree with them, but add that it doesn't make any difference regarding the toast or firmness of the toast--at least, not for me. Nevertheless, I subtracted one star from what would have been a 5-star rating.
customer_reviews.author: CrankyToday

customer_reviews.title: Good Features, works well but gets very HOT
customer_reviews.text: The toaster and all features work well, however, it gets very hot. After 1 use, it won't burn you but you won't like touching it either. If you immediately use it a 2nd time, it becomes a burn hazard. It is very light so to use the buttons (cancel, etc), you need to hold somewhere to keep it from sliding and it is hard to find a place to do that where it is not hot stainless steel. It does cool down quickly but I wish I'd known about this before I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Reliable so far
customer_reviews.text: This replaces a Tefal toaster (original version) that we had, but which perished as a result of a water leak that ruined our kitchen. Compared to the Tefal: I like the looks of the Tefal better This one is able to toast dense whole-wheat bread in one pass, where the Tefal required two. We have used it regularly for 7 weeks. If it fails, I will update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Colan

customer_reviews.title: Toaster, No! Warm bread maker, yes!
customer_reviews.text: Not a cheap toaster. I thought that the name would mean it was better than others, but I thunk I was wrong. It doesn't toast bread well. I can put sourdough in, set dial to 5 (out of 6) and the bread doesn't even change color. Warm and slightly crispier, yes, but i want toast, not warm bread.
customer_reviews.author: McFarly

customer_reviews.title: Bad Toaster
customer_reviews.text: Bought this toaster at the beginning of January 2020, it already stopped working. The heating element went out on it! It's a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Decent toaster
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfectly fine toaster. I bought it in part because of the wide openings so I can fit a bagel in it. Works great for that. There is a special setting for bagels that I don’t like at all. It only toasts the inside of the bagel and it leaves the outside soft, very “bready” and barely warm. I don’t use the bagel setting because of this. It’s personal preference so if that’s how you like your bagel then this is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Conscious Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Design flaws ruin it.
customer_reviews.text: A sharp looking toaster that is in serious need of some design upgrades. It needs rubber feet to stop it from sliding. If you try pressing any of the buttons it just slides backwards until it backs into something. So good luck pressing that cancel button while the thing is 900 degrees and moving around everywhere. Next, the tines that hold the object to be toasted are too short, so if you attempt to toast something thin, it's falling into the toaster, never to be seen again. Last, it doesn't eject smaller items like muffins or pastries far enough, even with the pull up handle feature. It might be okay with some design changes, but don't bother until then.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sad!
customer_reviews.text: Tried the Krups KH732D and immediately disliked it. I have used a T-Fal Avante for about 15 years and it just died, great toaster. I like having cool to touch sides and the Krups was hot enough to get burned or melt the bread bag plastic. I can't get past the hot stainless sides and have sent it back. I initially bought the Krups based on the question section indicating cool or warm sides by users, I disagree.
customer_reviews.author: Gawain

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Got this from Warehouse Deals almost a year ago and the left side plunger began to not stay down, thus the 3 stars. Other reviewers have stated the same problem. Customer service was great in setting us up with the return for a repair keeping us from becoming part of the "throw away society." Toaster works as it should and toasts evenly when everything is working. Great warranty and service.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Not Up to Krups Standards
customer_reviews.text: We payed more for this toaster than others because we trust the Krups brand. Not anymore. The first thing I noticed about this toaster is how flimsy it seemed. The toaster mechanism is very loose. Ok maybe that doesn't impact functionality. However it never toasted evenly. One side is burnt while the other is just right. Before you ask I do not use the bagel setting. This is a piece of junk. Get an inexpensive toaster from a company that is known for toasters.
customer_reviews.author: joluvscards

customer_reviews.title: Good looking toaster - but only toasts one side :(
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping the negative reviews didn't come true- they did-- it only toasts one side... tried a couple different types of bread slices-
customer_reviews.author: Index

customer_reviews.title: Lousy
customer_reviews.text: I like my English muffins toasted ... On the dark side, and even at highest setting they are not Brown. My$10.00 toaster worked better I have to run toaster twice and is a water of time will not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Susan DeClario

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t toast even - worse as it ages.
customer_reviews.text: This roster has been junk from the start. It’s beautiful and sleek, but at first it wouldn’t toast enough. I thought perhaps because the components were new, so gave it the befit off longer usage. Had it for a few years now and the second round of toast always cooks more than the first - to the point of burning one side. The toaster I had before was way nicer, but I wanted a stainless steel one. Bad choice for the price!
customer_reviews.author: OU Student

customer_reviews.title: Crumby!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty but the crumb tray is too small. You will be forever brushing crumbs off your counter. I had to put something under the new toaster to catch the crumbs. Not worth the money because of poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent for the money
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great toaster for the money. It toasts evenly and quickly. Actually, the most important thing to me was if it was easily cleaned. The toaster I replaced still worked, I was just sick of the pointless channels around the top of the slots. For that toaster to stay clean I'd have to shake the crumbs out or go around it with a q-tip every time it was used. The Krups toaster caught my eye because it has ZERO nooks or crannies. It looks great all the time - well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: zelda

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster!
customer_reviews.text: Best toaster I've ever used! Incredible how it actually HEATS up the toast, just doesn't flash it brown. Read a TON of reviews before purchasing this as I am QUITE picky and this was the ONE! Highly recommended toaster, look forward to many years of great service from this product. Real sharp looking on the counter, too, and doesn't take up a ton of space like most 4-slice toasters do.
customer_reviews.author: thershegoesagn

customer_reviews.title: Don`t buy a toaster from Germany
customer_reviews.text: dont like to send bad reviews,but! I generally buy the $12 toasters at a store we all shop at ( Ours are blue), anyway, toaster died. i purchased this one, family will be coming in the summer and it will get lots of use. Jokes on me, after 7 pieces of toast, toaster will no longer work. so I spent $5 to toast each piece, and now it will cost me what i woukd have paid for the cheap toasters to ship it to a warrent center to have it looked at. save a headache, go to wallyworld and buy a toaster
customer_reviews.author: lowell5225

customer_reviews.title: Love this modern/sleek toaster
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence when reading some of the reviews about uneven toasting, etc. but fell in love with the design as soon as I saw it so thought I'd learn for myself. I am so glad that I did, after about 20 uses, it still hasn't missed the mark regardless of what setting it is on. It is absolutely gorgeous and receives tons of compliments - the 4-slot format is also perfect for meal prep as you don't have to worry about the first set getting cold... etc. Must buy if you're in the market for a toaster!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, practical and flexible.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's a bit pricey for a toaster, but the shiny metal design looks retro, will last longer and should be easy to clean. It's a good size for sitting on the counter. Bagels, bread and small naan were evenly heated. The crumb tray pulls out at the front, so it's easier to clean. I only give it 4 stars because I'm still finding the toasting time a bit inconsistent, and it feels a little slow. Sometimes the slowness means it burns the toast, but usually it's perfect. The chromed plastic button and dial don't seem as substantial or well designed as the rest of the toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J. Trenn

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster....
customer_reviews.text: Love this toaster. I had a Hamilton Beach toaster that I gave away as it didn't brown the toast at all. This one does make great toast, has wide slots that will also toast a bagel, there is button for it. Will also toast frozen bread and has a button for that too. I have a Krups coffee maker which is great so I was hoping a Krups toaster would also be great and it didn't disappoint me. Removeable crumb tray. As I said I love it as does my hubby who no longer complains about his toast not being toasted.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy W

customer_reviews.title: Fake or bad produce
customer_reviews.text: Less than a month and already does not work. See the video. This has to be a fake! Lately amazon is selling trash, it is not the first time that I buy something on amazon that is not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Julio

product_meta.title: KRUPS KH734D Breakfast Set 4-Slot Toaster with Brushed and Chrome Stainless Steel Housing, 4-Slices with Dual Independent Control Panel, Silver
product_meta.description: Style Name:4-Slice| Size:4-SliceHoused in brushed and chrome stainless steel, this high quality KRUPS KH734D50 toaster not only looks good on the counter, but it also toasts bread to perfection—up to four slices at a time. The unit's extra large, self centering slots (1.5 inches wide by 5.75 inches long) can accommodate a variety of items, including bagels, buns, English muffins, and thick slices of homemade bread. For added convenience, dual independent controls make it possible to use only one side or the other, or to toast two unique orders simultaneously, like bread on one side and waffles on the other, making it easier to get the whole family out the door on time in the morning. Choose bagel mode for warming the outside and toasting the cut side of bagels; defrost mode for toasting items like frozen waffles, toaster pastries, or toaster hash browns; reheat mode for warming without toasting; or the cancel function to end the session at any time. You just have to turn the knob to select one of the six browning settings, from light to dark. Other highlights include blue LED indicators, a high lift lever for smaller items, two removable crumb trays for easy cleaning, and cord storage to help keep countertops looking tidy. The KRUPS KH734D50 four slice toaster offers exceptional convenience on its own or as part of the matching KRUPS Breakfast Set ensemble. Wattage is 1500.
feature_bullets: 4 Slice Toaster: Toast upto 4 slices of bread to crispy perfection; dual independent control panels to toast at different browning levels simultaneously; extra large, self centering slots ensure even browning and accommodate a variety of breads, including bagels, buns, English muffins, and more
6 Browning Settings: Choose preferred level of browning thanks to the shade setting dial, ranging from 1 (lightest) to 6 (darkest)

4 Push Button Functions: Defrost toasts frozen bread longer to ensure consistent results; Reheat allows for reheating toast so it warms without added browning; Bagel warms the outside and toasts the inside of bagels; Cancel ends the toasting session at any time
High lift lever: Raises smaller pieces of bread up and out of toaster for safe, easy retrieval

User friendly modern design: Removable crumb tray for easy cleaning; brushed and chrome stainless steel with blue LED indicators for sleek contemporary style; handy cord storage; 2 year worldwide warranty

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars5,637 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
